alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 9:35PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Smith, northeastern Phillips, southern Franklin and southwestern Webster Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 934 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Franklin to 9 miles southeast of Bloomington to 10 miles south of Naponee. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Riverton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
